moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. c3 Bg7 4. Bb5: not very common: d4 is the move...
moves.4... e6 5. Ba4 Ne7 6. d3: still no d4: time to push White back...
moves.7... O-O 8. Bc2 b5: in fact, loss of tempo for Black, but anything goes right now...
moves.9. h4: White is clearly not into this type of opening: he should castle, and break up the center with d4...
moves.10. Bg5 f6 11. Be3 d4 12. Bd2: White has spent half of his moves, on controlling his Bishops...
moves.12... Nbc6 13. h5 e5: opening up the LSB diagonal: Bg4 is not nice...
moves.20. Qg4 Bf7: and so, Black holds the LSB...
moves.21. Bxg5: White needs to give back material, to make something work...
moves.21... fxg5 22. Qxg5+ Ng6: Black is winning the exchange: the White Queen has to buckle...
moves.23. Qg3 Qb6: Blacks' center is not penetrable: time to stir up trouble; b2 is the target...
moves.24. b3 Qxc6 25. Qxd3 Rfd8: we save Ra8 for playing Rc8...
moves.27. Kf1: and with this move, White resigned: after Rd1+,  it is checkmate... after Qe3 - the only one - Black is winning also...
